thinking.disposable_income: McKinley Park has a median household income of $70,411, with about 36.4% of households earning less than $50,000. The per capita income of $32,106 suggests moderate disposable income levels, making residents somewhat sensitive to transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution, many households have limited discretionary spending capacity. Higher sales taxes would impact household budgets, especially for the 36.4% lower-income households who spend a larger proportion of income on necessities
thinking.accessibility: The community shows diverse transportation usage: 51.5% drive alone, 21.7% use transit, and 12.7% carpool. 12.2% have no vehicle access, making transit accessibility crucial. The high car ownership (87.8% have at least one vehicle) suggests good driving accessibility is also important
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized proposals with moderate tax rates (1%) to balance transit funding and household budget impact. 2. Favored lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to support the significant transit-dependent population. 3. Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to reduce congestion while not overly burdening the majority who drive. 4. Selected proposals that achieve good transit time improvements without excessive costs. 5. Considered the mixed-income nature of the community requiring balanced cost structure
